arm_group.description: Subcutaneous injection around the areola with 2-4 points Methylene blue with 1ml of 1% Indocyanine green with 1ml of 0.5%

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to compare the sentinel lymph node (SLN) detection rate of
      early breast cancer patients between using Indocyanine green (ICG) and Methylene blue with a
      novel surgical navigation system.

clinical_study.brief_title: Application of Surgical Navigation System in Sentinel Lymph Node of Breast Cancer Research

link.description: A Website from Key Laboratory of Molecular Imaging, Chinese Academy of Sciences

facility.name: Key Laboratory of Molecular Imaging, Chinese Academy of Sciences

clinical_study.official_title: Study of Surgical Navigation System in Detection of Sentinel Lymph Node of Early Breast Cancer Patients

overall_official.affiliation: Key Laboratory of Molecular Imaging, Chinese Academy of Sciences

primary_outcome.description: Participants will be followed for the duration of hospital stay, an expected average of 1 year

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: Key Laboratory of Molecular Imaging, Chinese Academy of Sciences

results_reference.citation: Chi C, Ye J, Ding H, He D, Huang W, Zhang GJ, Tian J. Use of indocyanine green for detecting the sentinel lymph node in breast cancer patients: from preclinical evaluation to clinical validation. PLoS One. 2013 Dec 16;8(12):e83927. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0083927. eCollection 2013.

collaborator.agency: Yijishan Hospital of Wannan Medical College

clinical_study.study_design: Endpoint Classification: Safety/Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
